column4: why do I keep getting a "dpkg --configure -a" error when running automatic updates?
then it just hangs when I do that
dpkg was interrupted, you must manually run 'dpkg --configure -a
help!
did you run dpkg --configure -a ?
clearing /var/lib/dpkg/updates seemed to do the trick
neat :-)
Does Grub try to load the correct partition ?
can you interrupt grub on startup ?
by pressing escape when it shows Grub loading stage 1 (something like that )
but I remember vaguely having had a similar situation and it appeared to be a newer kernel I installed but didn't work, I could launch into the older one this way
but that doesn't help me when I am into Ubuntu and keep stalling
it can't complete an update without stalling
: is it necessary that you update ?
I don't do updates unless I have a reason, not anymore that is, I had problems with updating the kernel just because update notifier sayd I should, now back on older kernel and everything fine :-)
what kernel are you running ? does it end with -33 or -34 ?
open Synaptic and look for  linux-image
I'm just guessing, but, I downgraded from -34 to -33 because i had problems
: You can downgrade the kernel with synaptic, but again, that's what worked for me
I know what you mean, I've had that too sometimes, but I'm glad I didnt go back to windoze yet...
i hope you use an floss os for more than just it being 'free' as in price
then go ahead and eat the food without being allowed to see the ingredients :p
yeah??, like what ? ;-)
that's short term thinking
